The interest of the Treaffise, and its importance at the present day, will hardly be questioned. It is at once the earliest systematic treatise on its subject, and the earliest monument of Roman theology. It transports us to a critical period in the history of Christian thought. Then, as now, the battle-ground of contending schools of opinion was the doctrine of the Person of Christ.
